title: Coronation Street’s Chris Harper hints that the Bethany Platt grooming storyline will soon be even more uncomfortable to watch
text:
An unconscious Bethany is left alone and vulnerable with evil Nathan 
Confused, Bethany followed him to bed and slept with him for the first time. 
Things will only get worse for Bethany as she becomes the central part in Corrie's new sex ring storyline, a development writers have had “heated discussions” over.

Calling the story an “important one to tell”, writer Jan McVerry has revealed that the show’s passionate writers have been in rows over how to get it right. 
“My own children are teenagers but others with very young children have asked ‘should we be going into this darker territory?'” she told the Daily Star . 
“We have had many discussions on how to tell the story,” she added as the newspaper claims “heated discussions” have taken place over it. 
Speaking to the Sunday People , the 39-year-old said: “Nothing can desensitise you to what ­survivors of sexual exploitation have gone through. It’s the most important storyline I’ve ever had.” Nathan Curtis offers to take Bethany Platt shopping in Coronation Stre 
He also revealed that he feels the pressure to “get it right” for the sex abuse victims, adding: “We want to reach out to people to let them know help is out there, and to tell ­abusers they can’t get away with it.” 
Chris also said that they are trying to show that paedophiles don’t come in the form of an older man with a “sticky suit, bad hair and bad teeth. 
“Often the reality is very different. The perpetrators could be any age, any colour or class, and so can the people affected.” Danger for Bethany Platt in Coronation Street as Nathan gets her drunk
